name: Hanbury Manor, A Marriott Hotel & Country Club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just arrived back from a night away. The manor house part of the hotel is lovely, oak panelling and huge fireplaces. The zodiac restaurant is also good, if the waiters are possibly a little hasty this is made up for with the atmosphere and good quality, well presented food. Portions a little on the small side for male eaters though.
reviews.title: not 5 star

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel with a friend and the experience couldn't have been more relaxing. Check in & out was smooth and the 12pm check out seemed more generous than some other hotels I've stayed in. The rate (admittedly with a discount for government employees) I felt was very fair and the breakfast included was HUGE. The deluxe room was large, clean and the beds deliciously appointed with lots of soft feathered pillows.
reviews.title: Relaxing Break

reviews.text: Spa did not disappoint. The pool was pretty & practically empty on the two occasions I used it and the jacuzzi and steam room were clean and again, empty. The only tiny tiny negative comment is someone forgot to turn on the sauna on the Sunday morning but hardly a serious flaw. The treatments we both had (Indian head massage & back, shoulders & neck massage) were prompt, professional and very relaxing.
reviews.title: Great Wekend ay Hanbury Manor

likes.liked: — Attention to detail and the attitude of the staff
likes.disliked: — Quite expensive, but you get what you pay for

reviews.text: Overall I highly recommend this hotel for the price & professionalism of its service.
reviews.title: Beautiful surroundings...

likes.disliked: — average room facilities & no character in the newer rooms!

reviews.title: Real luxury
reviews.text: I booked a short weekend stay for my wife and myself as mini relaxation break after a hectic Christmas period. We had booked in only fo the Saturday night on a Dinner, B&B package.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel at 2.30 and were treated very eficiently and courtesouly at the reception. Our room was in the new wing of the main building and it takes 3-4 minutes t walk through the corridors and halls to reach the further parts of the complex. We reached our room to find that whilst lovely it was two double beds and not a king room. Not normally accustomed to create a fuss I did ring the guest services desk and explain I had requested a king bed room. They were very helpful and promised to call me back. We had not received a call 10 minutes later so left to return to the main reception as we had booked afternoon tea for 3.30pm. As we reached the reception area we were greeted by one of the staff who apologised for the problem with the room, supplied us with new keys to an alternative room and arrnaged for us to have our luggage moved whilst we enjoyed the afternoon tea.
reviews.title: Wonderful night away

reviews.text: Booked a prestige room for one night. Room not as per room description on website. No slippers, iron/ironing board or clock radio. No turn down service.
reviews.title: Not all its cracked up to be

reviews.text: Room was dusty in areas, paint flaking from windows and cracks in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Great location but not 5 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had dinner in the Zodiac restaurant which was really good. The food was perfectly cooked and the waiters - 2 young guys from Nepal were extremely attentive.
reviews.title: Not representative of the Marriott Brand.

reviews.text: All in all I would not rate this value for money.
reviews.title: Hanbury Manor gone drastically downhill

likes.disliked: — Over priced wine and cocktails. Poor, unfriendly, unhelpful service in Cocktail Lounge

reviews.title: Great for business but lacks soul

likes.liked: — The old part of the hotel
likes.disliked: — Beyond its facade it is just another corporate

aka: Marriott Hanbury Manor Hotel And Country Club
